response: narrative=Julie Kirk, a young girl living with her foster parents, left her home on Leachkin Road, Inverness, in the middle of the night, sparking concerns among her caretakers. Before her disappearance, whispers of her association with a local political fringe group caught the attention of her foster father. Her decision to wander away at such an hour brought memories of a previous incident where she was found at an obscure location, a cave near Longman Road, Inverness. As the search extended, her foster mother revisited the youth center, imagining the child might seek familiar grounds. Eventually, the police traced Julie to Culduthel Park, safe and unharmed, ending her brief but worrying absence.

narrative=Julie Kirk went missing from her home at Leachkin Road, Inverness, and concerns grew due to her fascination with an online game, which often led her to interact with unknown groups. This obsession sometimes hid deeper issues, potentially including suspected visa complications affecting her foster status. Julie was last known to have visited the Balmakeith Industrial Estate. Her whereabouts remained unknown until she was traced by police to an address on Seaforth Road, Muir of Ord. Leads indicated she might have traveled to Inverness, particularly around Lotland Street, likely exploring places connected to the online community she was involved with.
narrative=Julie left with Conor, obsessed with an online game, last seen in vehicle near caves.

narrative=Julie Kirk left home in the middle of the night, possibly due to suspected visa issues and association with a political fringe group. Last seen near 167 Culduthel Road, Inverness, authorities speculate she may have had interactions at the location. The foster father, concerned, reported her missing to ensure precautions were taken.

narrative=Julie Kirk, an 8-year-old girl, was last seen near her foster home on Leachkin Road, Inverness. On the day of her disappearance, she had visited the gym with her foster mother and Shirley Cox, a colleague of the foster mother, located on Sir Walter Scott Drive, Inverness. After a routine practice, Julie seemed content and was seen leaving the gym. Her foster mother believed Julie might have felt adventurous and took the wrong turn while walking back home. The vehicle-related factors came into play as a friend last saw Julie running through the parking lot situated on 25 Harbour Road, Inverness. With mounting concern for Julie’s wellbeing, a city-wide search was initiated. Eventually, a member of the public recognized her at 11 Eastgate, Inverness, bringing her safely back to her foster home.

narrative=Julie Kirk, a vibrant 8-year-old with a penchant for adventures, was reported missing from a dance studio located at 11 Eastgate, Inverness. Her foster mother discovered she was not at the dance studio when she went to pick her up. Julie had developed an obsession with an online game group, which seemed to capture her attention more than her usual activities. It's believed that her fascination with the game may have led her to wander off to meet friends from this virtual world. Sightings of a girl resembling Julie were reported near a movie theater on Glenurquhart Road. Meanwhile, her friend mentioned seeing her talking about wanting to visit the tutoring center on Sir Walter Scott Drive. Police traced her steps and, fortunately, found her safe at 11 Eastgate, where she had returned after realizing the dangers of her actions.
narrative=Julie was last seen at Leachkin Road by her foster mother before heading to a playground. Her friend later reported seeing her near a vehicle, but she vanished shortly after.

narrative=Julie Kirk's foster mother reported her missing when she didn't return home. Garry mentioned seeing Julie near a vehicle at Culduthel Avenue, Inverness. She was later found safe near a cave in the area.

narrative=Julie Kirk was last seen leaving 8-10 Linkwood Way, Elgin, in the middle of the night. Her foster father reported concerns about her obsession with an online game linked to a mysterious cave group. She was later found safe.

narrative=Julie Kirk went missing after not returning from music lessons at 167 Culduthel Road, Inverness. Her foster mother became worried when Julie didn't arrive home and started contacting Julie's friends and Shirley Cox, a colleague, who mentioned Julie's recent obsession with an online game. There were concerns that she might have met someone through this game and gone to another location. Julie was known to frequent 25 Harbour Road, Inverness, where several vehicles were parked. Additionally, there was speculation about her suspected visa issues potentially influencing her disappearance. She was eventually found safe by family at 11 Eastgate, Inverness.

narrative=Julie Kirk was last seen at her home on Leachkin Road, Inverness. Her foster mother noticed a heightened interest in an online game, which seemed to captivate Julie's attention more than usual. On the day of her disappearance, she mentioned visiting a friend at Orchard Park in Beauly but never arrived. Her foster father attempted to reach her several times, without success. Concerned, they reached out to Julie's friend and the friend's foster mother, learning that no plans were made to meet at Orchard Park. After a citywide search, she was found safe by the police at Culduthel Park. Julie had become engrossed in an online group meetup, losing track of time.
narrative=Julie Kirk disappeared from near 35 Cranmore Drive, Inverness after leaving Shirley Cox's vehicle parked nearby the cave.
